feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student implemented a functioning financial application that accepts debts, computes balances/timelines, tracks savings goals, and offers payoff strategies (implementation demo and outputs cited). Discovery and reflection show the app was purpose-built to meet a financial need, satisfying the criterion for a working financial tool.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The submission describes a functional budgeting/debt app with inputs, tracking, and suggested strategies but provides no mention or evidence of AI components (models, ML, APIs, NLP, etc.). Given the absence of AI-specific implementation or explanation across Discover/Implement/Reflect, the criterion for effective AI integration is not met.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "pretty much what I made through Replet. I made an app. Um, it's like a debt solver. So, you can put um you can put debts in. And so if you had like a student loan, put the original amount. Then you put your current balance, uh interest rate and then like whatever you want your monthly payment to be and then your due date. Um and then you can also do like savings goals."
"it's also I have it on my phone so can look at the same thing here."

"So now as you can see you can see the total debt um basically what you want to pay monthly payment when you'll be debt free um and then it has like your total saved to pay off your loans and then it has like the debt progress and then if you click on it gives you strategies on like how you could be able to pay uh your debt best off uh in the least amount of time."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: identified user need (people overwhelmed by loans). Implement: built and demonstrated a working app on Replit/phone. Reflect: explained how the tool addresses the problem.
criteria.reasoning: The student implemented a functioning financial application that accepts debts, computes balances/timelines, tracks savings goals, and offers payoff strategies (implementation demo and outputs cited). Discovery and reflection show the app was purpose-built to meet a financial need, satisfying the criterion for a working financial tool.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "pretty much what I made through Replet. I made an app."

"you can put debts in. And so if you had like a student loan, put the original amount. Then you put your current balance, uh interest rate and then like whatever you want your monthly payment to be and then your due date."
"and then if you click on it gives you strategies on like how you could be able to pay uh your debt best off uh in the least amount of time."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover, Implement, Reflect â€” The student describes the problem context (Discover), the implemented app and its inputs/features (Implement), and reiterates the user need and intended benefit (Reflect). None of these stages mention AI methods, models, or AI-based integration.
criteria.reasoning: The submission describes a functional budgeting/debt app with inputs, tracking, and suggested strategies but provides no mention or evidence of AI components (models, ML, APIs, NLP, etc.). Given the absence of AI-specific implementation or explanation across Discover/Implement/Reflect, the criterion for effective AI integration is not met.
